result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesus Yadiel Medina-Sifonte was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court costs, victim witness surcharges, DNA surcharge.  To be collected by DOC from 25% of prison funds.  Balance to be paid during term of Extended Supervision.  Nonpayment penalty shall result in a  civil judgment.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving the first 18 months of his sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain GED or HSED.  Vocational assessment.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing.
No contact with Samuel P.-L, Rosairo P.-V. and La Tiendta located at 3100 W. Mitchell Street.
No alcohol or controlled substances.

Cooperate with agent.
Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program.
Parenting classes.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens and breathalyzers.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a  DNA sample, pay related surcharge.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesus Yadiel Medina-Sifonte

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jesus Yadiel Medina-Sifonte in court via video with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Jesus Yadiel Medina-Sifonte in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Restitution hearing proceeded.  Victim does not appear.  Court sets restitution at $0.

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court, defendant Jesus Yadiel Medina-Sifonte not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court involved in a Jury Trial.  Restitution hearing adjourned.  Defendant at Dodge Correctional and to appear via video.  Video technician notified.  Restitution hearing scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Character letters to be used at

Defendant Jesus Yadiel Medina-Sifonte in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Jesus Yadiel Medina-Sifonte in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 5 1/2 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 2 1/2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program, after serving the first 18 months of his sentence. 
-Restitution to be determined
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing
-Cooperate with agent 
-Obtain GED or HSED
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-No contact with Samuel P-L; Rosairo P-V and La Tiendita located at 3100 W. Mitchell Street
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Parenting classes
-Vocational assessment

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

Matter scheduled for a restitution hearing

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
  Restitution hearing scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jesus Yadiel Medina-Sifonte in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered defendant Remanded into the custody of the sheriff's department pending sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court, defendant Jesus Yadiel Medina-Sifonte not in court, in custody.  
Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations. 
Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.
  Plea hearing scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Original PRELIMINARY HEARING / ARRAIGNMENT Transcript (11 pages) commencing MAY 5, 2015, received and filed.  jm

Defendant Jesus Yadiel Medina-Sifonte in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Jesus Yadiel Medina-Sifonte in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Angela Juarez-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Samuel PL; Rosario PV (Samuel's Mother) or La Tiendita at 3100 W Mitchell Street, Milwaukee

Defendant Jesus Yadiel Medina-Sifonte in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Jesus Yadiel Medina-Sifonte in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
